answers.answer: Hello!How much is your thickening of left ventricle in millimeters? This will give a fair idea of the percentage of functioning of your total capacity. You can go for a stress test to determine this.Left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) is the thickening of the myocardium (muscle) of the left ventricle of your heart. This can occur after a reaction to high blood pressure.Discuss with a cardiologist and take your diabetes and blood medications regularly.Left ventricular hypertrophy is not a disease, it is usually a marker for disease involving the heart.Take care!

question: i am 72 retired bank officer, married , two sons 35 and 33, weight 74kg , height 5'7"no smoking (for 25 years) no alkahol,had pilo plasty of both kidneys, bp 90/160-on loserton 50mg, type 1 diabetic -on diamicron 60mg a day.ziloric 100mg a daynow diagonised- thickening of left venticle walls and unfolding of ayorta ?what is the position of my heart - alarmed
title: heart desease
